definition: first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.english: They were enriched with the wisdom of God, and girded with the panoply of heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他們因上帝的智慧而富足，以天上的甲冑爲配備。

sentences.english: He tried to buckle his armours on.
Play ally, armor, weapon, item, and ability cards during your turn.
sentences.chinese: 輪到你的回合時，使用軍隊，甲冑，武器，能力。

sentences.english: Where were their armour and their arms?
sentences.chinese: 他們的甲冑和干戈藏在哪裏呢？

sentences.english: It is an armour and a weapon.
Harness of Carnal Instinct no longer has bonus armor.
sentences.chinese: 肉體本能甲冑不再享有護甲加成。

sentences.english: Heavily armed foot soldier of ancient Greece whose function was to fight in close formation.
sentences.chinese: 古代希臘披掛重型甲冑的步兵，以密集隊形進行戰鬥。

sentences.english: He was just going to take out the armour when Don Quixote again lifted his lance.
sentences.chinese: 他正要把甲冑拿出來，唐吉訶德又舉起他的長矛。

sentences.english: The leading role in the film is costumed in medieval armor.
sentences.chinese: 影片中的主角穿着中古時代的甲冑。

definition: to put on a suit of armor/to put on dress/to wear
